datafield.subfield: edited by Avner Raban and Kenneth G. Holum.

pt. 1. Ancient harbors: geomorphological challenge and technological response. Caesarea: unique evidence for faulting patterns and sea level fluctuations in the late Holocene / Yossi Mart and Ilana Perecman. -- Cements, concrete, and settling barges at Sebastos: comparisons with other Roman harbor examples and the descriptions of Vitruvius / Christopher Brandon. -- Further evidence for the use of concrete in ancient harbor construction / David J. Blackman. -- pt. 2. Caesarea and comparative harbor studies. The Hellenistic harbor of Phalasarna in western Crete: a comparison with the Hellenistic inner harbor of Straton's tower / Elpida Hadjidaki. -- Harbor structures of the Augustan age in Italy / Piero A. Gianfrotta. -- Caesarea's master harbor builders: lessons learned, lessons applied? / Robert L. Hohlfelder. pt. 3. Caesarea's city plan and urban architecture. The evolution of the urban plan of Caesarea's southwest zone: new evidence from the current excavations / Yosef Porath. -- "Amphitheatrical" Hippo-Stadia / John H. Humphrey. -- King Herod's Temple of Roma and Augustus at Caesarea Maritima / Lisa C. Kahn.

Warehouses and granaries in Caesarea maritima / Joseph Patrich. -- A sixth-century bath in Caesarea's suburbs and the transformation of bathing culture in late antiquity / Fred L. Horton, Jr. -- pt. 4. The promontory Palace: architecture and power. The promontory palace / Ehud Netzer. -- Ruler and spectacle: the promontory palace / Kathryn Louise Gleason. -- Palace to praetorium: the romanization of Caesarea / Barbara Burrell. -- pt. 5. Sculpture from Caesarea, public and private. Marble, urbanism, and ideology in Roman Palestine: the Caesarea example / Mosche Fischer. -- Miscellaneous ornamented architectural elements in Roman Caesarea / Yehudit Turnheim and Asher Ovadiah. -- Representations of deities and the cults of Caesarea / Rivka Gersht. -- pt. 6. Caesarea's economy and society: the evidence of objects. Toward the study of economics at Caesarea Maritima / Jeffrey A. Blakely. -- Caesarea illuminated by its lamps / Varda Sussman. -- Articactual evidence for the history of the harbors of Caesarea / John Peter Oleson, with contributions by Robert L. Hohlfelder, Andrew N. Sherwood, and Steven E. Sidebotham.

pt. 7. Caesarea and its people in the light of inscriptions. The city and the text / Clayton M. Lehmann. -- Synagogue officials: the evidence from Caesarea and its implications for Palestine and the Diaspora / Lee I. Levine. -- Arabic inscriptions from Caesarea maritima: a publication of the Corpus Inscriptionum Arabicarum Palaestinae / Moshe Sharon. -- pt. 8. The Jewish and Christian communities: society and thought. The Jews and the games in Roman Caesarea / Ze'ev Weiss. -- The Halachic status of Caesarea as reflected in the Talmudic literature / Ephrat Habas. -- Reflections on the Aggada of Caesarea / Marc Hirshman. -- Caesarea maritima and the survival of Hellenistic-Jewish literature / David T. Runia. -- Jewish and Christian academics in Roman Palestine: some preliminary observations / Hayim Lapin. -- pt. 9. Origen, Eusebius, and their influence. Eusebius of Caesarea as a Christian writer / Lorenzo Perrone. -- The idea of the city in early Christian thought: Caesarean perspectives / David Satran. -- Eusebius of Caesarea and the imperial Christian idea / Héléne Ahrweiler.

pt. 10. Caesarea and Palaestina. Roman roads to Caesarea maritima / Israel Roll. -- The See of Caesarea in conflict with Jerusalem from Nicaea (325) to Chalcedon (451) / Ze'ev Rubin. -- Metropolis and Provincia in Byzantine Palestine / Leah Di Segni. -- pt. 11. Issues in the archaeology and history of Caesarea. Stratonos Pyrgos -- Migdal Śar -- Sebastos: history and archaeology / Robert R. Stieglitz. -- The legal and administrative status of the Port of Sebastos during the early Roman period / Dan Barag. -- The survival of the Bouleutic Class at Caesarea in late antiquity / Kenneth G. Holum. -- The inner harbor basin of Caesarea: archaeological evidence for its gradual demise / Avner Raban. -- pt. 12. Archaeological research and public response. The roles of the amateur and the professional in maritime archaeological research / Alexander Flinder. -- The Genesis of scientific underwater exploration in Israel centered at Caesarea, under the patronage of Baron Edmond de Rothschild / Elisha Linder.
